content.$t: latitude: -42.828889, eid: rbdc, name: Evaluation of the Citizens' Basic Income Program in Maricá, Brazil, type: Ongoing, location: Maricá, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil, dates: Dec 2019- Present, recipients: 42,000 individuals, implementer: Program Implemented by Municipal Government of Maricá, Evaluation Implementation Agency TBD, researcher: Jain Family Institute and Universidade Federal Fluminense, funder: Municipal Government of Maricá through its share of revenue from offshore oil wells, targeting: Recipients are geographically targeted (must live in Municipality of Marica) and means/proxy-means tested (part of Brazil's Cadastro Único, a unified registry for social benefits). Also, need to complete general application form to be part of the Program, unit: Individuals, amount: 130 mumbucas (R$130 or about US$30), frequency: Monthly, evaluation: Individual outcomes through regression discontinuity design (quasi-experimental method), price/inflation analysis through synthetic control difference in difference analysis (planned), Study also contains longitudinal interviews/qualitative component., notes: Marica has established its own form of currency spendable only within the city, the mumbuca. As a result, individuals who benefit receive their monthly transfer of mumbucas through a debit and the mumbucas can be used to purchase local goods using the card or an app. This was designed to keep the money local., website: https://www.maricabasicincome.com/ , linkurl1: https://theglobalamericans.org/2019/12/renda-basica-da-cidadania-what-lessons-could-latin-americas-largest-basic-income-program-bring-to-research-on-universal-basic-income/ , linktitle1: Renda Básica da Cidadania: What lessons could Latin America’s Largest asic income program bring to research on Universal Basic Income? (Paul Katz, Stephen Nuñez, and Fábio Waltenberg), linkurl2: https://www.jainfamilyinstitute.org/assets/marica_fact_sheet_32420.pdf, linktitle2: Maricá Basic Income Fact Sheet (including recent COVID-19 response ), linkurl3: https://www.vox.com/future-perfect/2019/10/30/20938236/basic-income-brazil-marica-suplicy-workers-party, linktitle3: More than 50,000 people are set to get a basic income in a Brazilian city

gsx$evaluation.$t: Individual outcomes through regression discontinuity design (quasi-experimental method), price/inflation analysis through synthetic control difference in difference analysis (planned), Study also contains longitudinal interviews/qualitative component.
